# authorizationStatus

**Instance Property**

The status of the user’s agreement to let the app access this reader’s sensor.

## Declaration

```swift
var authorizationStatus: SRAuthorizationStatus { get }
```

## Discussion

When an app wishes to read data from a particular sensor, it checks for user approval first by accessing the value of this property. If the value is [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRAuthorizationStatus/authorized], an app may begin recording (see [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRSensorReader/startRecording()]) and execute data fetches (see [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRSensorReader/fetch(_:)]).

If the value is [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRAuthorizationStatus/denied], an app can’t begin recording or execute fetches until the user switches on authorization for the reader’s sensor in Settings.

If the value is [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRAuthorizationStatus/notDetermined], the user has not answered the in-app prompt. To display the prompt, call [doc://com.apple.sensorkit/documentation/SensorKit/SRSensorReader/requestAuthorization(sensors:completion:)].

## Checking user authorization

- **requestAuthorization(sensors:completion:)**: Requests user permission to read one or more sensors.
- **SRAuthorizationStatus**: The states that model whether the user approves the app to read a particular sensor.
